subtitles.transcript: We’re a part of a broader society that doesn’t meet its obligations to serve all of its people.
We are part of a country that doesn’t meet its obligations to serve all of its people.
So to the extent that we are a part of that bigger system, no, we’re not entirely
meeting that obligation, nor have we ever done so. But I do think that we do — that we have
an obligation, we absolutely have an obligation to be representative of the state of California
and to represent the diversity that exists across the state. I mean, I think us being a public university
with a public-university mission is actually really central. I mean, it’s not something that we can afford
to have lost and still be who we are — like it’s just kind of built into the fiber of who we are as a university.
